headline: Pineapple Upside-Down Cheesecake
description: This pineapple upside-down cheesecake recipe is a delicious combination of two classic desserts. The creamy cheesecake pairs well with fruity pineapple.
name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cheesecake
recipeIngredient: 2 (8 ounce) cans pineapple slices, drained well

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).

Mix 2 tablespoons butter and brown sugar together in a 9-inch round cake pan until blended; spread mixture to evenly cover the bottom of the pan. Top with pineapple slices, then place one cherry into the center of each slice.
Mix graham cracker crumbs, 3 tablespoons white sugar, and remaining 3 tablespoons melted butter together in a small bowl until well combined. Press mixture over pineapple slices.

Beat cream cheese and 3/4 cup white sugar in a bowl until blended. Add sour cream and vanilla; mix well. Add eggs, one at a time, mixing on low speed after each addition until blended. Pour batter into the cake pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until the center is almost set, 55 minutes to 1 hour. Remove from the oven.
Run a knife around the inside edge of the pan to loosen. Allow to cool completely, about 30 minutes. Invert onto a serving plate and refrigerate for at least 3 hours before serving.

review.reviewBody: I think there was too much of a Graham cracker crust. After cooling and removing from the pan, the crust was still very wet and stuck to the pan. The cheesecake was also very flat. Iâ€™d make a pineapple upside down cheesecake again, but definitely not with this recipe.
This how my Pineapple Upside-Down cheesecake turned out. One thing I forgot to mention in my first review is that I added one cup of sugar to the cream cheese filling instead of 3/4 cup.
I made this as written. Some raved 5 star and some said it needed more sugar in the filling. While it is good, keep in mind you might want it sweeter depending on your palate.
